title: Best cycling deals 2021: Black Friday bike and kit discounts
content:
Joe Robinson
22 Nov 2021

A round up of the best cycling deals to be found on the web on Black Friday 2021

Like David Dickinson in a Herefordshire auction room, we go mad for a bargain here at Cyclist. Black Friday 2021 falls on November 26th, and we've done the hard work for you and assembled the best cycling deals online in one handy guide.

From bike computers to helmets, winter jackets to turbo trainers, there are deals to be found everywhere, you’ve just got to know where to look. Sale periods like Black Friday are always good for tech discounts, and also handy for picking up bargains on out-of-season kit too.

Below, we have hand-picked some of the best deals on cycling goods this Black Friday, so far. If nothing takes your fancy now check back in at a later date as we'll keep this page regularly updated.

The best cycling deals UK

Vittoria Rubino clincher tyre

  • Was £23.99, now £11.99, save 48%

One of the most respected winter tyres here at Cyclist HQ, the Vittoria Rubino mixes a 150tpi nylon casing and long-life tread compound to create a tyre that is both durable and effective at resisting punctures.

Not the fastest but winter is all about slow, long miles, right?

  • Read Cyclist's Vittoria Rubino tyre review here
  • Get a set of Vittoria Rubino clinchers tyres from Wiggle now

Proviz Reflect360 Plus cycling jacket

  • Was £119.99, now £96.99, save 20%

Proviz is known for being leaders in the hi-vis/reflective cycling clothing market thanks to its phenomenal 100% reflective glass bead material that has you lit up like a Christmas tree when exposed to artificial light such as car headlamps and street lights.

There is 20% off site-wide for Proviz this Black Friday so why not pick up a few bits while you’re at it.

  • Buy a Proviz Reflect 360 cycling jacket from Proviz now

MyoMaster MyoPro massage gun

  • Was £349, now £149, save 55%

Whether you need to tenderise a beef joint or loosen a particularly tight hamstring, the MyoPro massage gun from MyoMaster packs 60lb of stall force into its lightweight aluminium body.

This particular set comes with eight interchangeable massage tips, a charge and handy travel case.

  • Read Cyclist's MyoPro massage gun review here
  • Snag a MyoMaster MyoPro massage gun from MyoMaster now

MyProtein All-Natural Protein Peanut Butter

  • Was £7.42, now £4.82, save 35%

A delicious way of introducing more protein into your diet, MyProtein’s All-Natural peanut butter is easy to spread, contains 30g of protein per 100g and is free from added salt, sugar, palm oil, and preservatives.

A particular favourite of deputy editor James Spender, who eats a reported 32.3kg of peanut butter per year.

  • Get a 1kg tub of MyProtein All-Natural Protein Peanut Butter from MyProtein now

Hammerhead Karoo 2 cycling GPS computer

  • Was £459.99, now £349.99, save 23%

A relative newcomer to the cycling GPS market, Hammerhead claims unrivalled mapping and 4G connectivity gives it the advantage over rivals Wahoo and Garmin. There’s also a full-colour 3.2in screen and on-board route creation to brag about, too.

This particular bundle also comes with a heart rate monitor, providing more data while you train.

  • Get the Hammerhead Karoo 2 from Wiggle now

Art of Cycling Cycling Classic T-shirt

  • Was £28, now £22.40, save 20%

The good folk over at Art of Football are offering a store-wide 20% off this Blaack Friday which means you can bag some of its Art of Cycling range at a steal.

Digital editor Joe Robinson personally owns this T-shirt and can attest to its comfort and quality. Plus, the packaging the T-shirt comes in is worth the purchase alone.

  • Snag a Art of Cycling T-shirt this Black Friday here

Zipp 303 S carbon tubeless disc wheelset

  • Was £985, now £837, save £148

A change of wheels can be among the most beneficial changes you can make to a bike and these Zipp 303 S disc wheels are among the best all-rounders on the market.

Tubeless-only, the 23mm internal rim width partners perfectly with 28mm tyres while the 45mm rim depth provides aerodynamic advantages too. At 1,530g, they are also respectably light.

  • Watch Cyclist's video on the Zipp 303 S wheelset here
  • Buy a set of Zipp 303 S disc wheels from ProBikeKit now

LifeLine bike tool kit

  • Was £49.99, now £29.99, save 40%

What it says on the tin – 18 essential tools that every amateur cyclist should have at home in a handy, storable kit and for a reasonable price.

Nab yourself one of these and we can guarantee that you will save yourself both time and money.

  • Get the LifeLine bike tool kit now from ChainReactionCycles

BTwin kids' 20" hybrid bike

  • Was £169.99, now £139.99, save 17%

With Christmas just around the corner, now could be a perfect time to invest in a bike for your kid with this 20" hybrid from Decathlon's in-house brand BTwin being a solid option.

Suiting 6- to 9-year-olds, with full mudguards, six gears, a basket and stand, this bike will help your little sprog gain confidence cycling on paths and roads alike. Avaliable in pink and blue.

  • Buy this 20" kid's hybrid from Decathlon now

Aftershokz headphone deal

  • Buy a set of Aftershokz Aeropex headphones and receive a pair of Air headphones free

Bone-conduction headphone allow you to listen to music while exercising while being able to maitain the ability to hear ambient noise.

Aftershokz is a specialisit in the market and is offering a free pair of its Air headphones (worth £99.95) when you buy a set of Aeropex headphones for £149.95. Limited to the first 400 purchases. 

  • Buy a set of Aftershokz Aeropex headphones and receive a pair of Air headphones free

Tacx Neo 2 smart turbo trainer

  • Was £1,199, now £799.99, save 33%

This time last year, smart turbo trainers were like hen's teeth so the fact that not only are they back in stock, you can pick them up at discount is frankly remarkable.

The Neo 2 smart from Tacx is one of the most advanced and the perfect partner for anybody looking to use training platforms such as Zwift and TrainerRoad this winter.

  • Read Cyclist's full review of the Tacx Neo Smart here
  • Buy the Tacx Neo 2 smart turbo trainer now from Wiggle
